This is a convenience method that opens a file, gets its content and then closes the file.

The IsText parameter is used to distinguish whether the file should be opened as a binary or text file.

### getRealPath() {#a68841d3d9bfc5d03b934a4826f922961}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::error&#95;code FileSystem::getRealPath (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; Path, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; char &gt; &amp; Output)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Gets real path of <code>Path</code> e.g.

collapse all . and .. patterns, resolve symlinks. For real file system, this uses <code><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs/#a2363fbfbd0a348f5d81fc3d3223ecae3">llvm::sys::fs::real&#95;path</a></code>. This returns <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a59739a4f15fb2ec57a6b7fcfe938546ba8344b3d509942f035d5e303022f9b986">errc::operation&#95;not&#95;permitted</a> if not implemented by subclass.

### makeAbsolute() {#a4181855db0a672fd3271cf9f867b58b4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::error&#95;code FileSystem::makeAbsolute (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; char &gt; &amp; Path) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Make <em>Path</em> an absolute path.

Makes <em>Path</em> absolute using the current directory if it is not already. An empty <em>Path</em> will result in the current directory.

/absolute/path =&gt; /absolute/path relative/../path =&gt; &lt;current-directory&gt;/relative/../path


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Path">A path that is modified to be an absolute path.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
success if <em>path</em> has been made absolute, otherwise a platform-specific error&#95;code.
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/virtualfilesystem-h/#l00333">333</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/virtualfilesystem-h">VirtualFileSystem.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/virtualfilesystem-cpp/#l00128">128</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/virtualfilesystem-cpp">VirtualFileSystem.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### openFileForRead() {#a65c402dbd63349a9e91c7102693d1db8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual llvm::ErrorOr&lt; std::unique&#95;ptr&lt; File &gt; &gt; llvm::vfs::FileSystem::openFileForRead (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; Path)</>}>
Get a <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/vfs/file">File</a></code> object for the text file at <code>Path</code>, if one exists.

### openFileForReadBinary() {#a16e0a1364b5172561351fe7968efb48f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual llvm::ErrorOr&lt; std::unique&#95;ptr&lt; File &gt; &gt; llvm::vfs::FileSystem::openFileForReadBinary (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; Path)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Get a <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/vfs/file">File</a></code> object for the binary file at <code>Path</code>, if one exists.

Some non-ascii based file systems perform encoding conversions when reading as a text file, and this function should be used if a file&#39;s bytes should be read as-is. On most filesystems, this is the same behaviour as openFileForRead.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/virtualfilesystem-h/#l00284">284</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/virtualfilesystem-h">VirtualFileSystem.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### setCurrentWorkingDirectory() {#a1c986ffa977f9bc4bbe9fbcf150c0ad0}

<MemberDefinition

Set the working directory.

This will affect all following operations on this file system and may propagate down for nested file systems.
